revision.text:
{{notability|date=November 2010}} '''The Family Foundation of Kentucky''' is a non-profit organization based in [[Lexington, Kentucky|Lexington]]. Headed by [[Kent Ostrander]], the Foundation serves as a public policy [[wikt:watchdog|watchdog]] on [[Kentucky]] issues affecting the family. Though often sympathetic to causes important to religious [[conservatism|conservatives]], the organization has no religious affiliation.
==Stances== Historically, the Foundation has stood in favor of:
*[[Abstinence education]] *Judicial restraint *Religious liberty in the public arena *Adult [[stem cell]] research
The Foundation has historically opposed:
*[[Abortion]] *[[Euthanasia]] *[[Same-sex marriage]] and the [[LGBT rights by country or territory|gay rights]] movement *Legalized or expanded [[gambling]] *[[Pornography]] and [[sexually oriented business]]es *Sale of alcoholic beverages *[[Embryonic stem cell research]]
==Publications== The Foundation publishes and distributes ''The Kentucky Citizen'', a bi-monthly newsletter.
==Flood== On September 23, 2006, The Family Foundation's headquarters was destroyed by a flood, costing them a number of irreplaceable documents and data.{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}}
==External links== *[http://www.kentuckyfamily.org/ Home page of The Family Foundation of Kentucky]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Family Foundation Of Kentucky}} [[Category:Political organizations in the United States]] [[Category:Non-profit organizations based in Kentucky]]
